title: 3D & 4D Ultrasound
shortDescription: 3D and 4D ultrasound imaging acquires volumetric data by collecting multiple 2D ultrasound planes using either mechanical sweeping transducers or electronic matrix arrays. These 2D images are spatially registered and algorithmically reconstructed into complete 3D volumes, which can be visualized through various rendering techniques (surface, maximum intensity, or realistic rendering). 4D ultrasound adds the temporal dimension by rapidly acquiring sequential 3D volumes (up to 20-30 volumes per second), enabling real-time visualization of dynamic three-dimensional structures. This technology allows clinicians to observe spatial relationships and movement patterns that cannot be fully appreciated with conventional 2D ultrasound.

title: 4D CT
shortDescription: Captures motion over time for dynamic CT (respiratory, cardiac gating).

title: Cystoscopy
shortDescription: The cystoscope is inserted through the urethra into the bladder, where it captures real-time video footage of the bladder lining and urethra

title: Hysteroscopy
shortDescription: The device is inserted through the cervix into the uterine cavity, where it transmits real-time video images to a monitor. This allows for direct visualization of the endometrial lining and intrauterine structures without the need for radiation or external imaging modalities

title: Contrast-enhanced Ultrasound
shortDescription: CEUS utilizes microbubble contrast agents to enhance ultrasound imaging, providing improved visualization of vascular structures and blood flow.

title: Doppler Ultrasound,Color Doppler,Spectral Doppler,Power Doppler
shortDescription: A non-invasive medical imaging technique that uses high-frequency sound waves to detect and measure the flow of blood through vessels, allowing for the diagnosis of conditions such as blood clots, varicose veins, and vascular diseases.

title: Mammography
shortDescription: A non-invasive medical imaging test that uses X-rays to measure bone mineral density (BMD) and assess bone health. It's commonly used to diagnose osteoporosis, monitor bone loss, and evaluate the risk of fractures.

title: Alternative Splicing and Transcript Assembly Formats
shortDescription: Detecting and reconstructing different RNA isoforms produced from a single gene.
status: in progress: Combining the solutions and integerating them in one code solution that dynamicly decide to choose the logic base on the type of input data to produce standard data type as output

title: Annotations
shortDescription: Annotations assign functional information to genomic regions
status: in progress: Combining the solutions and integerating them in one code solution that dynamicly decide to choose the logic base on the type of input data to produce standard data type as output

title: Ballistocardiography (BCG)
shortDescription: Ballistocardiography (BCG) records the mechanical recoil of the body caused by the ejection of blood with each heartbeat, offering insights into cardiovascular health and cardiac function through non-invasive motion sensing.
status: in progress: Conversion table revised by F.Zolfaghari

title: B-mode (2D Ultrasound)
shortDescription: Brightness Mode Ultrasound, or B-Mode Ultrasound (2D Ultrasound), is a widely used medical imaging technique that produces two-dimensional images of internal structures using high-frequency sound waves

title: Blood Pressure Waveform (BPW)
shortDescription: Blood Pressure Waveform (BPW) represents the continuous variation of arterial pressure over time, measured invasively (arterial line) or non-invasively (finger cuff, tonometry), important for hemodynamic monitoring and cardiovascular assessment.
status: in progress: Conversion table revised by F.Zolfaghari

title: Breast Magnetic Resonance Imaging
shortDescription: Breast MRI is a non-invasive imaging technique that uses magnetic fields and radio waves to produce detailed images of breast tissue, often used to detect cancer or assess abnormalities.

title: Bronchoscopy
shortDescription: Video bronchoscopy acquires images using a fiber-optic or video-based flexible bronchoscope equipped with a miniature CCD (Charge-Coupled Device) or CMOS (Complementary Metal-Oxide-Semiconductor) camera at its distal tip

title: Respiratory Waveform (Capnography - EtCO₂)
shortDescription: Capnography measures the concentration of exhaled carbon dioxide (CO₂) over time, providing a respiratory waveform (capnogram) that is crucial for monitoring ventilation, airway status, and metabolic activity.
status: in progress: Conversion table (section 3.1.) should be updated by Farhan!

title: cephalometric_radiography
shortDescription: Specialized head/neck radiograph for orthodontic evaluation.

title: Cardiac Magnetic Resonance Imaging
shortDescription: Cardiac MRI is a non-invasive imaging technique that uses magnetic fields and radio waves to create detailed pictures of the heart’s structure and function.

title: Conventional CT
shortDescription: Standard computed tomography using rotating X-ray source.

title: CT Colonography (Virtual Colonoscopy)
shortDescription: CT Colonography (CTC), also known as virtual colonoscopy, combines X-ray computed tomography (CT) with advanced 3D reconstruction software to visualize the colon’s interior noninvasively.

title: CT Angiography (CTA)
shortDescription: Contrast-enhanced CT for vascular imaging of arteries and veins.

title: CT Perfusion
shortDescription: CT perfusion (CTP) uses a CT scanner and contrast to assess brain blood flow, aiding stroke diagnosis with X-ray imaging.

title: Dual-energy CT (DECT)
shortDescription: CT acquisition at two X-ray energy levels for material decomposition.

title: Cone Beam CT
shortDescription: CBCT captures 2D projections with a cone-shaped X-ray, reconstructing them into a detailed 3D image with lower radiation than CT.

title: Cephalometric Radiography
shortDescription: Cephalometric Radiography (Ceph) uses a parallel X-ray beam and cephalostat to capture 2D craniofacial images for orthodontic planning, taken at 5 feet to reduce distortion

title: Panoramic Radiography
shortDescription: OPG imaging uses a rotating X-ray beam and a synchronized film or sensor to capture a panoramic 2D view of the entire oral and maxillofacial region in a single scan.

title: Differential Expression and Statistical Analysis Formats
shortDescription: Identifying genes with statistically significant changes in expression between conditions.
status: in progress: Combining the solutions and integerating them in one code solution that dynamicly decide to choose the logic base on the type of input data to produce standard data type as output

title: Diffusion MRI (DWI/DTI)
shortDescription: Diffusion-weighted imaging (DWI) and diffusion tensor imaging (DTI) are advanced MRI techniques that exploit the diffusion properties of water molecules to provide unique insights into tissue architecture. DWI measures the random Brownian motion of water molecules within tissues, allowing for the detection of abnormalities such as acute ischemic strokes, where diffusion is typically restricted.

title: Electroencephalography (EEG)
shortDescription: EEG (Electroencephalography) captures electrical brain activity through electrodes placed on the scalp, producing continuous time-series signals critical for diagnosing neurological conditions and conducting brain research.
status: in progress: Conversion table revised by F.Zolfaghari

title: Electrocardiography (EKG/ECG)
shortDescription: EKG (Electrocardiography) records the electrical activity of the heart over time using electrodes placed on the body, crucial for diagnosing cardiac abnormalities such as arrhythmias, myocardial infarction, and other heart-related conditions.
status: in progress: Conversion table revised by F.Zolfaghari

title: Elastography
shortDescription: Elastography measures tissue stiffness by assessing mechanical properties such as elasticity and viscosity. It uses ultrasound (Shear Wave Elastography, Acoustic Radiation Force Impulse Imaging) or MRI (Magnetic Resonance Elastography) to track the propagation of mechanical waves through the tissue. The speed of these waves correlates with tissue stiffness, which helps evaluate liver fibrosis severity.

title: Electromyography (EMG)
shortDescription: EMG (Electromyography) measures the electrical activity produced by skeletal muscles using electrodes, critical for diagnosing neuromuscular disorders and evaluating muscle function during movement and rehabilitation.
status: in progress: Conversion table revised by F.Zolfaghari

title: Functional Magnetic Resonance Imaging
shortDescription: fMRI (functional Magnetic Resonance Imaging) is a brain imaging technique that measures brain activity by detecting changes in blood flow.

title: Gallium Scan
shortDescription: Gallium scans detect infection, inflammation, and tumors by using injected gallium radiotracers (Gallium-67 or Gallium-68) that accumulate in active tissue, imaged with gamma cameras or PET scanners after a delay.

title: Genome Assembly
shortDescription: Genome Assembly reconstructs complete genomes from sequenced fragments
status: in progress: Combining the solutions and integerating them in one code solution that dynamicly decide to choose the logic base on the type of input data to produce standard data type as output

title: High-resolution CT (HRCT)
shortDescription: Thin-slice CT typically for detailed lung imaging.

title: Intravascular Ultrasound (IVUS)
shortDescription: Intravascular Ultrasound (IVUS) is an invasive imaging technique that uses a miniature ultrasound probe mounted on a catheter to visualize the interior of blood vessels, particularly coronary arteries

title: Video laryngoscopy
shortDescription: Video laryngoscopy (VL) acquires images using a high-resolution camera mounted on a laryngoscope blade, which transmits real-time video of the airway and vocal cords to an external monitor

title: Low-dose CT (LDCT)
shortDescription: Reduced radiation-dose CT often for lung cancer screening.

title: Lymphoscintigraphy
shortDescription: Lymphoscintigraphy uses technetium-99m-labeled radiotracers to visualize lymphatic flow and map sentinel lymph nodes using gamma or SPECT imaging, aiding in cancer staging and evaluation of lymphatic disorders.

title: Mammography (Conventional, Digital, Tomosynthesis, Contrast-enhanced)
shortDescription: Mammography uses low-dose X-rays to acquire high-resolution images of breast tissue for cancer screening, diagnosis, and disease monitoring.

title: MIBG Scan
shortDescription: MIBG scans use radioactive metaiodobenzylguanidine tagged with iodine isotopes, detected by a gamma camera or SPECT system, to visualize neuroendocrine tumors such as neuroblastoma and pheochromocytoma.

title: Magnetic Resonance  Myelography
shortDescription: MR myelography is a non-invasive MRI technique that visualizes the spinal cord, nerve roots, and cerebrospinal fluid without using contrast dye injected into the spinal canal.

title: Magnetic Resonance Urography
shortDescription: MR urography is a non-invasive imaging technique that uses MRI to visualize the kidneys, ureters, and bladder for evaluating urinary tract disorders.

title: Magnetic Resonance Angiography (MRA)
shortDescription: Magnetic Resonance Angiography (MRA) is a specialized imaging technique that leverages the principles of Magnetic Resonance Imaging (MRI) to visualize blood vessels without the need for invasive procedures or ionizing radiation. By utilizing strong magnetic fields and radiofrequency pulses, MRA detects the behavior of hydrogen nuclei in blood, producing detailed images of the vascular system.

title: Magnetic Resonance Spectroscopy (MRS)
shortDescription: Magnetic Resonance Spectroscopy (MRS) is a non-invasive imaging technique that extends the capabilities of traditional Magnetic Resonance Imaging (MRI) by providing detailed biochemical information about tissues. MRS focuses on detecting and quantifying metabolites within the body, offering insights into metabolic processes.

title: Mass Spectrometry (MS) Data Formats
shortDescription: Measures the mass-to-charge ratio of protein fragments to determine their identity and modifications.
status: in progress: Combining the solutions and integerating them in one code solution that dynamicly decide to choose the logic base on the type of input data to produce standard data type as output

title: Phonocardiography (PCG)
shortDescription: Phonocardiography (PCG) is a technique that records the acoustic signals produced by the heart, capturing heart sounds and murmurs as time-series audio signals, widely used for cardiac diagnostics and heart sound analysis.
status: in progress: Conversion table (section 3.1.) should be updated by Farhan!

title: Phylogenetic Analysis
shortDescription: Phylogenetic Analysis infers evolutionary relationships between organisms based on their sequences
status: in progress: Combining the solutions and integerating them in one code solution that dynamicly decide to choose the logic base on the type of input data to produce standard data type as output

title: Positron Emission Tomography (PET), PET-CT, PET-MRI
acronyms: Positron Emission Tomography - Magnetic Resonance Imaging
shortDescription: PET imaging uses positron-emitting radiotracers to visualize metabolic processes. PET-CT fuses functional and anatomical data, while PET-MRI combines molecular imaging with detailed soft tissue contrast, aiding oncology, neurology, and cardiology diagnostics.

title: Pulse Oximetry (Photoplethysmography - PPG)
shortDescription: PPG (Photoplethysmography) is an optical technique that measures blood volume changes in the microvascular bed of tissue, widely used in pulse oximetry for monitoring heart rate and oxygen saturation (SpO₂).
status: in progress: Conversion table revised by F.Zolfaghari

title: Annotation and Metadata Formats
shortDescription: Provides descriptive information about proteins, such as function, location, or experimental context, to enhance data interpretation.
status: in progress: Combining the solutions and integerating them in one code solution that dynamicly decide to choose the logic base on the type of input data to produce standard data type as output

title: Sequence Data Formats
shortDescription: Examines the amino acid order in proteins to identify patterns, similarities, or functional regions.
status: in progress: Combining the solutions and integerating them in one code solution that dynamicly decide to choose the logic base on the type of input data to produce standard data type as output

title: Protein Interaction and Pathway Data Formats
shortDescription: Studies how proteins interact with each other and participate in biological processes or signaling networks.
status: in progress: Combining the solutions and integerating them in one code solution that dynamicly decide to choose the logic base on the type of input data to produce standard data type as output

title: Protein Structure Data Formats
shortDescription: Analyzes the 3D conformation of proteins to understand their function and stability.
status: in progress: Combining the solutions and integerating them in one code solution that dynamicly decide to choose the logic base on the type of input data to produce standard data type as output

title: RNA-Seq Quantification and Analysis Formats
shortDescription: Using high-throughput sequencing to quantify RNA transcripts and analyze their features.
status: in progress: Combining the solutions and integerating them in one code solution that dynamicly decide to choose the logic base on the type of input data to produce standard data type as output

title: Seismocardiography (SCG)
shortDescription: Seismocardiography (SCG) captures chest wall vibrations induced by cardiac activity using accelerometers, offering a non-invasive assessment of cardiac mechanics such as heart valve movements, myocardial contractility, and timing of cardiac events.
status: in progress: Conversion table revised by F.Zolfaghari

title: Scintigraphy (Bone, Thyroid, Myocardial Perfusion)
shortDescription: Scintigraphy uses gamma-emitting radiopharmaceuticals to create 2D images of targeted organ or tissue function, detected via external gamma cameras, often employed in bone, thyroid, and cardiac imaging.

title: Single-Cell RNA-Seq (scRNA-Seq) Data Formats
shortDescription: Profiling gene expression at the individual cell level to uncover cellular heterogeneity.
status: in progress: Combining the solutions and integerating them in one code solution that dynamicly decide to choose the logic base on the type of input data to produce standard data type as output

title: Sequence Alignments
shortDescription: Sequence Alignments compare DNA sequences to identify similarities
status: in progress: Combining the solutions and integerating them in one code solution that dynamicly decide to choose the logic base on the type of input data to produce standard data type as output

title: Single Photon Emission Computed Tomography (SPECT)
shortDescription: SPECT uses rotating gamma cameras to reconstruct 3D images of radionuclide distribution in the body, offering functional imaging capabilities for diverse clinical applications like brain, cardiac, and bone disorders.

title: Standard MRI
shortDescription: MRI uses strong magnetic fields and radio waves to generate detailed images of the body's internal structures. It detects hydrogen atoms' response to magnetic fields, allowing high-resolution visualization of soft tissues.

title: Transcranial Doppler (TCD)
shortDescription: Transcranial Doppler (TCD) is a non-invasive ultrasound technique that measures blood flow velocity in the major arteries of the brain, particularly within the Circle of Willis

title: Transcriptome Assembly and Annotation Formats
shortDescription: Reconstructing full RNA transcripts from sequencing data and assigning functional annotations.
status: in progress: Combining the solutions and integerating them in one code solution that dynamicly decide to choose the logic base on the type of input data to produce standard data type as output

title: Gene Expression Data Formats
shortDescription: Measuring the activity levels of genes by quantifying RNA abundance in a sample.
status: in progress: Combining the solutions and integerating them in one code solution that dynamicly decide to choose the logic base on the type of input data to produce standard data type as output

title: Phylogenetic and Evolutionary Analysis Formats
shortDescription: Studying RNA sequences to infer evolutionary relationships and gene conservation across species.
status: in progress: Combining the solutions and integerating them in one code solution that dynamicly decide to choose the logic base on the type of input data to produce standard data type as output

title: Sequence Data Formats (Raw and Processed Sequences)
shortDescription: Examining the nucleotide sequences of RNA molecules to identify patterns, variants, or functional elements.
status: in progress: Combining the solutions and integerating them in one code solution that dynamicly decide to choose the logic base on the type of input data to produce standard data type as output

title: Variant Calls
shortDescription: Variant Calls detect genetic differences like mutations
status: in progress: Combining the solutions and integerating them in one code solution that dynamicly decide to choose the logic base on the type of input data to produce standard data type as output

title: XRay_CR
shortDescription: Computed radiography (CR) is a digital imaging technique that uses photostimulable phosphor (PSP) plates to capture X-ray images instead of traditional film

title: XRay_DR
shortDescription: Digital radiography is an advanced imaging technique that uses digital X-ray sensors instead of traditional photographic film to capture and store radiographic images
